content.sentence:
What does a construction foreman do?

A construction foreman supervises workers and checks daily progress on site.

What does a construction foreman do?

He reads blueprints and explains the layout to the masons and carpenters.

What does a construction foreman do?

He plans the next day’s work and assigns tasks to each team.

What does a construction foreman do?

He doesn’t check the scaffold before workers start climbing.

What does a construction foreman do?

He uses measuring tapes, spirit levels, and marking tools during inspection.

What does a construction foreman do?

He does not ignore safety rules or missing helmets on the site.

What does a construction foreman do?

He checks the quality of concrete and ensures it cures properly.

What does a construction foreman do?

He orders materials like sand, cement, and steel rods in advance.

What does a construction foreman do?

He does not record the daily work report or attendance of workers accurately.

What does a construction foreman do?

He coordinates with the site engineer and reports any construction delays.

content.intro: The BuildLine 400 Digital Laser Level helps construction workers measure level and alignment with precision.

subsections.subtitle: Main Components
items: Laser Emitter – projects a visible horizontal or vertical beam for alignment.
Control Panel – includes the power button, mode selector, and sensitivity settings.
Tripod Mount – attaches the laser level securely for stable positioning.
Battery Compartment – holds rechargeable lithium batteries.
Receiver Sensor – detects the laser beam over long distances.
Bubble Vials – assist in manual levelling during setup.
Charging Port – used to recharge the internal battery.
Carrying Case – protects the device during transport.

steps: Unpack the unit and ensure all parts are included.
Attach the tripod mount on a firm surface.
Insert the batteries and press the Power button.
Adjust the bubble vials to ensure the laser is level.
Select Horizontal or Vertical Mode using the control panel.
Position the receiver sensor where the beam should fall.
Once aligned, mark the reference point or install materials accordingly.
After use, turn off the unit and store it in the carrying case.

subsections.subtitle: Common Issues and Solutions
items: Laser Not Visible: Check battery charge or clean the laser window.
Inaccurate Level Line: Re-level the tripod or recalibrate the device.
Receiver Not Detecting Beam: Ensure there’s no bright sunlight interference.
Power Failure: Recharge the battery fully or check the charger connection.

subsections.subtitle: Maintenance Tips
items: Keep the laser lens and bubble vials clean.
Do not expose the unit to rain or extreme heat.
Calibrate the laser every three months for accuracy.
Use only the recommended charger.
Store in a dry, dust-free environment.
Never stare directly into the laser beam.
Do not point the beam at people or reflective surfaces.
Ensure the tripod is stable before operating.
Turn off the laser before moving it between locations.
Use protective gloves and boots when working on uneven ground.
